transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.  

The Church does not accept many things.  For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.  

These are important issues. Many people disagree with the Church's views. 

If the Church was more modern, it would not lose so many people. 

Some people disagree with the Church because of its views on abortion. If you want an abortion, you may not feel welcome in the Church. 

Same with gay marriage. If you support gay marriage, you may not feel comfortable in a Church that does not. 

I think women should be priests and priests should be able to marry. But I do not know if this would have stopped the bad things that happened. 

Everyone else has work and family. Priests should too.

I am okay with gay marriage.  I think being gay is not a choice. People should not be blamed for who they love.  It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can get married. 

I do not know much about this topic, but I think it is wrong to say that some people can get married and others cannot.  It seems that people are born gay, just like some people are born straight.

It is not right to make people feel bad for being gay. I do not think the government should tell people who can and cannot marry. It is a personal choice. The government should not get involved in people's lives like this.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason why it should not be legal. Some say gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are different, but still similar.

Gay marriage is a civil right. It means having the same rights as straight couples. For example, if a gay partner is sick, they can visit their partner in the hospital. They can make medical decisions for each other.

Many studies show that gay couples are just as happy as straight couples. They have the same kind of love and commitment.

Gay people are not asking to marry in church. They just want a marriage certificate from the government. This is a legal matter, not a religious one.

Some people say that gay marriage is against their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay marriage is like segregation. It is unfair to treat gay couples differently.

People worry about adoption and children. Will children of gay parents be okay?

Studies show that children of gay parents are just as happy and well-adjusted as children of straight parents.

Some schools treat children of gay parents badly. This is wrong. All children deserve to be treated fairly.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This is the fair and right thing to do.

I work at a hospital pharmacy in the summer.  I think drugs should be legal if they are good for people. Some drugs are illegal, but good for health.  
For example, some people use oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These are strong drugs, but doctors use them to help people.  
I think marijuana is like these drugs. It can help people. We should not say it is bad just because it is illegal. 

Alcohol is also bad if you use too much. But, marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change people's minds, they might use it safely.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. We would go to church together.

Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They come in their beach clothes. Families often run in late. Even at the morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is how casual people dress.

I don't know much about the church's politics, but this is what I see.



About the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped this. Some married men become pedophiles. It is a person's choice to become a priest.

Some religions allow priests to marry. If people want to practice their faith and be married, they could choose a different religion.

I think pedophilia is genetic. People are born that way. It is not about how they are raised. A marriage cannot hide it. 

If the church knew about abuse and covered it up, that is wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War.  After 9/11, the Bush government said Iraq was involved. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons. This is not true. 

The Bush government lied to America. Colin Powell spoke at the UN. He said he did not believe the evidence, even when he spoke. This is wrong. It is wrong to lie to the people. I think the Bush government does not respect our rules.

I think they wanted to go to war from the start.  I think they wanted to hurt Saddam Hussein because his father hurt America before.  I think they wanted to control Iraq's oil. 

The war has gone on too long. Leaving now will cause problems. Iraq might have a civil war.  

The UN and America want other countries to help. They want Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this will cause more problems.

Iraq should be in control of itself. The government is not working well. The Parliament is not strong. The Prime Minister does not have power.

There are many groups fighting for control.  The leader of one group, Muqtada al-Sadr, has many seats in Parliament. 

It is hard to say what will happen.

I feel the war in Iraq is a complicated problem.  It began after the attacks on September 11th. Many people think the war was a way for the United States to get revenge on Iraq.

I do not like the war. I do not understand all the details. It seems like we are trying to help Iraq build a democracy, but it is taking a long time. Some people also think we want to control Iraq's oil.

Staying in Iraq has made people angry. If we leave now, they may be upset that we did not help them build a strong democracy.

Building a democracy is difficult. It takes time and effort. It is unfair to force a new system on a country.

I know many families have loved ones in Iraq. I want them to come home safely.  

But I worry about what staying in Iraq means for the people there. The war has caused a lot of damage. It has made it hard for people to live normal lives. 

I also worry about the United States. Staying in Iraq is expensive and dangerous. It makes the president look weak.

The war in Iraq is a difficult situation.  I do not know the best solution.

I do not think it is right to make this action legal. I do not think any state should make it legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says the government and church should be separate. This is clear. It is written in the Constitution. I think it is wrong to try to control this. It would go against what the Constitution says.

Some people want to make it illegal. I think they are choosing one church's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support this. 

The separation of church and state is important. It allows for religious freedom in the United States. Even if they try to make a change to the Constitution, I think it would be wrong. It would go against what is already there. This change would be one of the few that restricts people, not the government.

I do not think the government should be involved. The president is pushing for this change because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is choosing one religion over others. I think it is up to the churches to decide, not the government. There is no good reason to change the Constitution. I don't see how it would affect the economy or anything else. It might even be good for society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue. Many people, including myself, believe the government was not honest with the American people about the reasons for war. The invasion was linked to the September 11th attacks, but the connection was weak. The government used the tragedy to influence public opinion and start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. The Iraq War feels like a repeat of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq. The goal was to remove the Iraqi government and install a democracy.  

However, the government was not prepared for the consequences. Removing a government creates a power vacuum and chaos. This happened in Vietnam too. The US tried to remove communists and establish democracy, but it was a long and difficult struggle.

The US government should have known this would be a difficult war.  

I think we should have planned better. We need to consider all possible outcomes before going to war. The government did not plan for what would happen after removing the Iraqi government. 

We are still in Iraq in 2006, with many American troops still dying. We are trying to train Iraqi troops and police, but it is a slow process. The US government made it seem like the war would be quick and successful, which was not realistic. 

Implementing a new government takes time and effort. It took a long time for the United States to become a successful democracy. We should not have expected Iraq to be different.

The government should have been honest with the people about the difficulties of this war.

Deciding whether to leave Iraq is difficult. We cannot abandon the people after removing their government.

However, we also need to consider the cost in American lives. How many casualties are too many?

We need to ask why we are only focusing on Iraq. Why not other countries that need help? Oil is a major factor in these decisions.

The initial justification for war, weapons of mass destruction, was not true. We knew North Korea had weapons, but we did not attack them. This raises questions about the government's motives.


I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But it seems unlikely.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. It is something that can be biological, not just a choice people make. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control.  

I think it is wrong to deny people rights because of who they love.  There are gay couples in my neighborhood. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live their lives.  

I do not think politics should decide who can get married. It is a personal matter. The government should not tell people who they can love.  

I have read that being gay might be something a person is born with. It could be in their genes.  It may not be a choice. 

Why is it so different for gay people? If a man and a woman want to get married, they can. But gay people cannot, even if they want to. That is not fair. Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

The internet is public. When you post things online, everyone can see them. As a resident assistant, I have seen this happen.

If you post about violence or hurting people, someone will notice. The school must act if they hear about it. They cannot ignore it.

But it is hard to know what is serious and what is a joke. Sometimes people say things online that they do not mean.

In one case, someone heard a student talk about hurting people. They told the school. The school looked at the student's Facebook page. There were things on the page that were scary. 

When you post online, you lose your privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. 

The school should not look at students' social media without a reason. But if someone tells them about something dangerous, they have to take it seriously.

I do not think teachers should be friends with their students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not right to watch what they post.

I feel the war has lasted too long. The goal at the start was good. We wanted to help another country have democracy. But now, I think we have forgotten that goal. We may be fighting just to show we are powerful. 

I also think the reasons for starting the war were not good. President Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. So, I think the war may have been started for personal reasons.

If the war was to help people have a fair government, that would be good. But I think our reason for fighting has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

The war should have ended after the first few months. We made our point then. It has been going on for many years, and it is too long.

Our soldiers need to come home. The country needs to spend money on its own problems, like poverty and bad schools. We have many people in need here, and we should help them.  

Spending billions of dollars on war is not good. We need to use that money to help our own people.

The war should end.

Can I ask a question to be sure?

Uh, it was stopped because someone saw it online.

Okay. 

Um, no, I do not think that is an invasion of privacy. On sites like Myspace, if you put information online, it is for everyone to see. I understand on Myspace you need a friend request to see someone's profile. You have to agree to be friends to let them see your information. So, you give them permission.

Anytime you put information online, many people can see it.  So I think it is good that someone saw it and could stop something bad from happening.

Um, it is hard. One person can't watch everyone's profile to prevent problems. But it would be unfair to target bad students.

I don't know. It depends on the situation. Did someone randomly look at profiles, or were they looking for evidence?

Sure. Um, I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a story on TV about a man who got information easily. He found a girl's screen name and started talking to her on instant messenger.

I would never meet someone like that. I have had people in my classes message me on Facebook. They don't use their real names, but I know it is them. It is strange because they know my interests, what I look like, my class schedule, my friends. They see lots of photos of me.

I try to be careful about what I post, but I also want to connect with friends. It is a hard balance. I only accept friend requests from people I know, but you never know who can see what.

Um, my roommate told me that her high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. I don't know if that is a privacy issue, but I don't think the school has the right to tell students what they can and cannot do online.

I feel bad talking about this. It is hard to say I was against the war from the start. Many people were against it, but it is not important now. The government does not want to admit they made a mistake. 

Most people think the war was a bad idea. Polls show that seventy-five to eighty percent of the world thinks so, including most Iraqis and U.S. troops. 

The war was a disaster from the beginning. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East.

The United States and the Middle East are very different. The government thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East, but it will not work. The people there want to live their own way.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the consequences before we invaded Iraq. It turned into a disaster.

I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.

I do not agree with the reasons the government gives for staying. They talk about problems that will happen if we leave, but I do not think those problems are real.

If we want to leave, we should do it quickly.

Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave within a year. A quarter want us to leave now. They are the people we are trying to help.

Maybe they know best. If we ask them if we should leave and they say yes, then it is not our fault if things go wrong.

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I agree that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It is not just a problem for women. It also affects men in certain fields.

For example, women often face a "glass ceiling" in the workplace. Even though equality is important, many women find it hard to reach top positions. They may be qualified, but some people might not want to promote them because society has always seen men in leadership roles.

Men also face discrimination. In some fields like fashion, men might be taken less seriously. People might assume that men who are interested in fashion don't truly understand it.

Another example is stay-at-home dads. It is uncommon for men to stay home and care for children. Some people think men should work and be the main earner. This can be hard on men who want to stay home and raise their children.

Changing these views takes time. Society has made progress, but change is slow.

We need to keep working to make things fairer. It's good to see more women in leadership roles and more men staying home with their children.

The best way to change things is to show people that these different roles are valuable. By highlighting the positive qualities of these individuals, we can help change people's minds.

They did not make marijuana legal. They changed the law so it is not a crime. It is now more like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested.  Many people worry about the effect on jobs and other things.  

It cost a lot of money to arrest people, hold them, and put them in court. This money could be used for schools, help for the elderly, or food for the homeless. Some communities do not want to use this money to pay for these things.  

In Denver, people are more open to this change. They think it is good for the city's money.

Marijuana should not be everywhere, like cigarettes. People would smoke it in cars, which is dangerous. Many people still think it is wrong to smoke marijuana.  

Alcohol has stronger effects on driving, but marijuana can have a bigger impact on people's lives.  

Everyone reacts to drugs differently. Some people can use them in a healthy way, while others have problems.

I think yes. 
Because many things they do are very old. 
They have done them for a long time.
It is good to follow traditions. 
But it is also good to change. 
Many Catholics go to church every week. 
They are strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I think the Catholic Church judges people who do not follow all the rules. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 
For example, my father was an Episcopalian. 
My mother was a Catholic. 
They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of my father's religion. 
This is not being kind to other religions. 
We were taught to love others. 
This is a Catholic teaching. 
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them. 
So I think many Catholic rules tell people to do things. 
But Catholic practice goes against these rules. 
The rules are old. 
But they keep using them.

I do not think this would change things. 
I think it would be good if priests could marry. 
But this would not stop them from hurting children. 
This is a different problem. 

People who hurt children would probably do it even if they were married. 
It is about the child, not the spouse. 
If someone wants to hurt a child, they will do it. 
Allowing priests to marry would not stop this.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not think either side is right or wrong. This is a very hard topic. It is hard to talk about religion and government at the same time. It is also hard to say what marriage is. I think all couples should have civil unions. I do not think the government should say what kind of marriage is right. If two people love each other, they should be able to get married. The government should not care if they are a man and a woman or two men or two women. People should not get special tax breaks or treatment just because they are married. The government should not tell people what to believe.

If all the states agree on a law, then they can make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution is for important things, not for things like this.

I am raised in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me. I have gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a national problem. Each state should decide.

Many states are Democratic. Many states are Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how that state feels. I think you should accept that if a state legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there.

I think gay people should have the same chances as straight people.  I think gay marriage should be legal by each state's choice.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should say the whole country is against gay marriage. It should be up to each state. I do not like his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think President Bush should decide for every state. He does not live in every state. He should not tell states how to run themselves.

Maybe a new president will change the ban on gay marriage.  It will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state. They will have to live with the decision. Not the president.

I do not agree. Myspace is a public site. It is like a bulletin board. If you post something, everyone can see it. This includes school officials.

Even if they are not looking at it under the school's name, they can still see it from home. So, if the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a school shooting, they have the right to see it.

Their job is to keep students safe. I think it is okay if they look at Myspace to make the school safer.

But, I think it is wrong if they look at Myspace just to find students doing bad things. They should not be looking for trouble.

If they see something that could help prevent a problem, like a school shooting, then it is okay. Remember, everything on the internet stays there forever.

It is like an email. If you write something bad about someone in an email, it could come back to haunt you later.

Even if you are a grown-up, things you post online can be found. It is always better to be careful about what you post.

The war was a bad idea. At first, I supported it. I felt hurt from nine eleven. I wanted revenge.  I thought we should make them suffer like we did. But now I think we made a big mistake. We went in without a plan. We did not think about the long term. We did not understand their culture.

Fighting there made things worse. They fight with each other, so we should let them. We cannot fix their problems. I do not care about what happens to them anymore. It feels like they are not human because they fight so much. 

We went to war unprepared. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. They do not want to make their country better. They want us to leave. I think we should leave.

We were angry after nine eleven. President Bush wanted to go to war. The people wanted him to. He felt we had to fight. I understand why he felt that way. We could not just ignore what happened. But we should have planned better.

We did not know what to do. There was no unity. We did not have a clear goal. We were driven by anger, not reason. This only made things worse.

I don’t think we can change them. They will always be like this. We have not made enough progress to justify staying there. We are hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.  

The Church does not accept many things.  For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.  

These are important issues. Many people disagree with the Church's views. 

If the Church was more modern, it would not lose so many people. 

Some people disagree with the Church because of its views on abortion. If you want an abortion, you may not feel welcome in the Church. 

Same with gay marriage. If you support gay marriage, you may not feel comfortable in a Church that does not. 

I think women should be priests and priests should be able to marry. But I do not know if this would have stopped the bad things that happened. 

Everyone else has work and family. Priests should too.

I am okay with gay marriage.  I think being gay is not a choice. People should not be blamed for who they love.  It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can get married. 

I do not know much about this topic, but I think it is wrong to say that some people can get married and others cannot.  It seems that people are born gay, just like some people are born straight.

It is not right to make people feel bad for being gay. I do not think the government should tell people who can and cannot marry. It is a personal choice. The government should not get involved in people's lives like this.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason why it should not be legal. Some say gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are different, but still similar.

Gay marriage is a civil right. It means having the same rights as straight couples. For example, if a gay partner is sick, they can visit their partner in the hospital. They can make medical decisions for each other.

Many studies show that gay couples are just as happy as straight couples. They have the same kind of love and commitment.

Gay people are not asking to marry in church. They just want a marriage certificate from the government. This is a legal matter, not a religious one.

Some people say that gay marriage is against their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay marriage is like segregation. It is unfair to treat gay couples differently.

People worry about adoption and children. Will children of gay parents be okay?

Studies show that children of gay parents are just as happy and well-adjusted as children of straight parents.

Some schools treat children of gay parents badly. This is wrong. All children deserve to be treated fairly.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This is the fair and right thing to do.

I work at a hospital pharmacy in the summer.  I think drugs should be legal if they are good for people. Some drugs are illegal, but good for health.  
For example, some people use oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These are strong drugs, but doctors use them to help people.  
I think marijuana is like these drugs. It can help people. We should not say it is bad just because it is illegal. 

Alcohol is also bad if you use too much. But, marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change people's minds, they might use it safely.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. We would go to church together.

Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They come in their beach clothes. Families often run in late. Even at the morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is how casual people dress.

I don't know much about the church's politics, but this is what I see.



About the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped this. Some married men become pedophiles. It is a person's choice to become a priest.

Some religions allow priests to marry. If people want to practice their faith and be married, they could choose a different religion.

I think pedophilia is genetic. People are born that way. It is not about how they are raised. A marriage cannot hide it. 

If the church knew about abuse and covered it up, that is wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War.  After 9/11, the Bush government said Iraq was involved. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons. This is not true. 

The Bush government lied to America. Colin Powell spoke at the UN. He said he did not believe the evidence, even when he spoke. This is wrong. It is wrong to lie to the people. I think the Bush government does not respect our rules.

I think they wanted to go to war from the start.  I think they wanted to hurt Saddam Hussein because his father hurt America before.  I think they wanted to control Iraq's oil. 

The war has gone on too long. Leaving now will cause problems. Iraq might have a civil war.  

The UN and America want other countries to help. They want Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this will cause more problems.

Iraq should be in control of itself. The government is not working well. The Parliament is not strong. The Prime Minister does not have power.

There are many groups fighting for control.  The leader of one group, Muqtada al-Sadr, has many seats in Parliament. 

It is hard to say what will happen.

I feel the war in Iraq is a complicated problem.  It began after the attacks on September 11th. Many people think the war was a way for the United States to get revenge on Iraq.

I do not like the war. I do not understand all the details. It seems like we are trying to help Iraq build a democracy, but it is taking a long time. Some people also think we want to control Iraq's oil.

Staying in Iraq has made people angry. If we leave now, they may be upset that we did not help them build a strong democracy.

Building a democracy is difficult. It takes time and effort. It is unfair to force a new system on a country.

I know many families have loved ones in Iraq. I want them to come home safely.  

But I worry about what staying in Iraq means for the people there. The war has caused a lot of damage. It has made it hard for people to live normal lives. 

I also worry about the United States. Staying in Iraq is expensive and dangerous. It makes the president look weak.

The war in Iraq is a difficult situation.  I do not know the best solution.

I do not think it is right to make this action legal. I do not think any state should make it legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says the government and church should be separate. This is clear. It is written in the Constitution. I think it is wrong to try to control this. It would go against what the Constitution says.

Some people want to make it illegal. I think they are choosing one church's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support this. 

The separation of church and state is important. It allows for religious freedom in the United States. Even if they try to make a change to the Constitution, I think it would be wrong. It would go against what is already there. This change would be one of the few that restricts people, not the government.

I do not think the government should be involved. The president is pushing for this change because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is choosing one religion over others. I think it is up to the churches to decide, not the government. There is no good reason to change the Constitution. I don't see how it would affect the economy or anything else. It might even be good for society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue. Many people, including myself, believe the government was not honest with the American people about the reasons for war. The invasion was linked to the September 11th attacks, but the connection was weak. The government used the tragedy to influence public opinion and start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. The Iraq War feels like a repeat of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq. The goal was to remove the Iraqi government and install a democracy.  

However, the government was not prepared for the consequences. Removing a government creates a power vacuum and chaos. This happened in Vietnam too. The US tried to remove communists and establish democracy, but it was a long and difficult struggle.

The US government should have known this would be a difficult war.  

I think we should have planned better. We need to consider all possible outcomes before going to war. The government did not plan for what would happen after removing the Iraqi government. 

We are still in Iraq in 2006, with many American troops still dying. We are trying to train Iraqi troops and police, but it is a slow process. The US government made it seem like the war would be quick and successful, which was not realistic. 

Implementing a new government takes time and effort. It took a long time for the United States to become a successful democracy. We should not have expected Iraq to be different.

The government should have been honest with the people about the difficulties of this war.

Deciding whether to leave Iraq is difficult. We cannot abandon the people after removing their government.

However, we also need to consider the cost in American lives. How many casualties are too many?

We need to ask why we are only focusing on Iraq. Why not other countries that need help? Oil is a major factor in these decisions.

The initial justification for war, weapons of mass destruction, was not true. We knew North Korea had weapons, but we did not attack them. This raises questions about the government's motives.


I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But it seems unlikely.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. It is something that can be biological, not just a choice people make. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control.  

I think it is wrong to deny people rights because of who they love.  There are gay couples in my neighborhood. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live their lives.  

I do not think politics should decide who can get married. It is a personal matter. The government should not tell people who they can love.  

I have read that being gay might be something a person is born with. It could be in their genes.  It may not be a choice. 

Why is it so different for gay people? If a man and a woman want to get married, they can. But gay people cannot, even if they want to. That is not fair. Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

The internet is public. When you post things online, everyone can see them. As a resident assistant, I have seen this happen.

If you post about violence or hurting people, someone will notice. The school must act if they hear about it. They cannot ignore it.

But it is hard to know what is serious and what is a joke. Sometimes people say things online that they do not mean.

In one case, someone heard a student talk about hurting people. They told the school. The school looked at the student's Facebook page. There were things on the page that were scary. 

When you post online, you lose your privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. 

The school should not look at students' social media without a reason. But if someone tells them about something dangerous, they have to take it seriously.

I do not think teachers should be friends with their students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not right to watch what they post.

I feel the war has lasted too long. The goal at the start was good. We wanted to help another country have democracy. But now, I think we have forgotten that goal. We may be fighting just to show we are powerful. 

I also think the reasons for starting the war were not good. President Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. So, I think the war may have been started for personal reasons.

If the war was to help people have a fair government, that would be good. But I think our reason for fighting has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

The war should have ended after the first few months. We made our point then. It has been going on for many years, and it is too long.

Our soldiers need to come home. The country needs to spend money on its own problems, like poverty and bad schools. We have many people in need here, and we should help them.  

Spending billions of dollars on war is not good. We need to use that money to help our own people.

The war should end.

Can I ask a question to be sure?

Uh, it was stopped because someone saw it online.

Okay. 

Um, no, I do not think that is an invasion of privacy. On sites like Myspace, if you put information online, it is for everyone to see. I understand on Myspace you need a friend request to see someone's profile. You have to agree to be friends to let them see your information. So, you give them permission.

Anytime you put information online, many people can see it.  So I think it is good that someone saw it and could stop something bad from happening.

Um, it is hard. One person can't watch everyone's profile to prevent problems. But it would be unfair to target bad students.

I don't know. It depends on the situation. Did someone randomly look at profiles, or were they looking for evidence?

Sure. Um, I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a story on TV about a man who got information easily. He found a girl's screen name and started talking to her on instant messenger.

I would never meet someone like that. I have had people in my classes message me on Facebook. They don't use their real names, but I know it is them. It is strange because they know my interests, what I look like, my class schedule, my friends. They see lots of photos of me.

I try to be careful about what I post, but I also want to connect with friends. It is a hard balance. I only accept friend requests from people I know, but you never know who can see what.

Um, my roommate told me that her high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. I don't know if that is a privacy issue, but I don't think the school has the right to tell students what they can and cannot do online.

I feel bad talking about this. It is hard to say I was against the war from the start. Many people were against it, but it is not important now. The government does not want to admit they made a mistake. 

Most people think the war was a bad idea. Polls show that seventy-five to eighty percent of the world thinks so, including most Iraqis and U.S. troops. 

The war was a disaster from the beginning. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East.

The United States and the Middle East are very different. The government thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East, but it will not work. The people there want to live their own way.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the consequences before we invaded Iraq. It turned into a disaster.

I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.

I do not agree with the reasons the government gives for staying. They talk about problems that will happen if we leave, but I do not think those problems are real.

If we want to leave, we should do it quickly.

Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave within a year. A quarter want us to leave now. They are the people we are trying to help.

Maybe they know best. If we ask them if we should leave and they say yes, then it is not our fault if things go wrong.

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I agree that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It is not just a problem for women. It also affects men in certain fields.

For example, women often face a "glass ceiling" in the workplace. Even though equality is important, many women find it hard to reach top positions. They may be qualified, but some people might not want to promote them because society has always seen men in leadership roles.

Men also face discrimination. In some fields like fashion, men might be taken less seriously. People might assume that men who are interested in fashion don't truly understand it.

Another example is stay-at-home dads. It is uncommon for men to stay home and care for children. Some people think men should work and be the main earner. This can be hard on men who want to stay home and raise their children.

Changing these views takes time. Society has made progress, but change is slow.

We need to keep working to make things fairer. It's good to see more women in leadership roles and more men staying home with their children.

The best way to change things is to show people that these different roles are valuable. By highlighting the positive qualities of these individuals, we can help change people's minds.

They did not make marijuana legal. They changed the law so it is not a crime. It is now more like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested.  Many people worry about the effect on jobs and other things.  

It cost a lot of money to arrest people, hold them, and put them in court. This money could be used for schools, help for the elderly, or food for the homeless. Some communities do not want to use this money to pay for these things.  

In Denver, people are more open to this change. They think it is good for the city's money.

Marijuana should not be everywhere, like cigarettes. People would smoke it in cars, which is dangerous. Many people still think it is wrong to smoke marijuana.  

Alcohol has stronger effects on driving, but marijuana can have a bigger impact on people's lives.  

Everyone reacts to drugs differently. Some people can use them in a healthy way, while others have problems.

I think yes. 
Because many things they do are very old. 
They have done them for a long time.
It is good to follow traditions. 
But it is also good to change. 
Many Catholics go to church every week. 
They are strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I think the Catholic Church judges people who do not follow all the rules. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 
For example, my father was an Episcopalian. 
My mother was a Catholic. 
They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of my father's religion. 
This is not being kind to other religions. 
We were taught to love others. 
This is a Catholic teaching. 
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them. 
So I think many Catholic rules tell people to do things. 
But Catholic practice goes against these rules. 
The rules are old. 
But they keep using them.

I do not think this would change things. 
I think it would be good if priests could marry. 
But this would not stop them from hurting children. 
This is a different problem. 

People who hurt children would probably do it even if they were married. 
It is about the child, not the spouse. 
If someone wants to hurt a child, they will do it. 
Allowing priests to marry would not stop this.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not think either side is right or wrong. This is a very hard topic. It is hard to talk about religion and government at the same time. It is also hard to say what marriage is. I think all couples should have civil unions. I do not think the government should say what kind of marriage is right. If two people love each other, they should be able to get married. The government should not care if they are a man and a woman or two men or two women. People should not get special tax breaks or treatment just because they are married. The government should not tell people what to believe.

If all the states agree on a law, then they can make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution is for important things, not for things like this.

I am raised in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me. I have gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a national problem. Each state should decide.

Many states are Democratic. Many states are Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how that state feels. I think you should accept that if a state legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there.

I think gay people should have the same chances as straight people.  I think gay marriage should be legal by each state's choice.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should say the whole country is against gay marriage. It should be up to each state. I do not like his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think President Bush should decide for every state. He does not live in every state. He should not tell states how to run themselves.

Maybe a new president will change the ban on gay marriage.  It will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state. They will have to live with the decision. Not the president.

I do not agree. Myspace is a public site. It is like a bulletin board. If you post something, everyone can see it. This includes school officials.

Even if they are not looking at it under the school's name, they can still see it from home. So, if the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a school shooting, they have the right to see it.

Their job is to keep students safe. I think it is okay if they look at Myspace to make the school safer.

But, I think it is wrong if they look at Myspace just to find students doing bad things. They should not be looking for trouble.

If they see something that could help prevent a problem, like a school shooting, then it is okay. Remember, everything on the internet stays there forever.

It is like an email. If you write something bad about someone in an email, it could come back to haunt you later.

Even if you are a grown-up, things you post online can be found. It is always better to be careful about what you post.

The war was a bad idea. At first, I supported it. I felt hurt from nine eleven. I wanted revenge.  I thought we should make them suffer like we did. But now I think we made a big mistake. We went in without a plan. We did not think about the long term. We did not understand their culture.

Fighting there made things worse. They fight with each other, so we should let them. We cannot fix their problems. I do not care about what happens to them anymore. It feels like they are not human because they fight so much. 

We went to war unprepared. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. They do not want to make their country better. They want us to leave. I think we should leave.

We were angry after nine eleven. President Bush wanted to go to war. The people wanted him to. He felt we had to fight. I understand why he felt that way. We could not just ignore what happened. But we should have planned better.

We did not know what to do. There was no unity. We did not have a clear goal. We were driven by anger, not reason. This only made things worse.

I don’t think we can change them. They will always be like this. We have not made enough progress to justify staying there. We are hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.

transformed_texts:
The Catholic Church needs to change some things. Many people are leaving the Church because its views are old.  

The Church does not accept many things.  For example, it is against gay marriage, abortion, and birth control.  

These are important issues. Many people disagree with the Church's views. 

If the Church was more modern, it would not lose so many people. 

Some people disagree with the Church because of its views on abortion. If you want an abortion, you may not feel welcome in the Church. 

Same with gay marriage. If you support gay marriage, you may not feel comfortable in a Church that does not. 

I think women should be priests and priests should be able to marry. But I do not know if this would have stopped the bad things that happened. 

Everyone else has work and family. Priests should too.

I am okay with gay marriage.  I think being gay is not a choice. People should not be blamed for who they love.  It is wrong to say that only a man and a woman can get married. 

I do not know much about this topic, but I think it is wrong to say that some people can get married and others cannot.  It seems that people are born gay, just like some people are born straight.

It is not right to make people feel bad for being gay. I do not think the government should tell people who can and cannot marry. It is a personal choice. The government should not get involved in people's lives like this.

Many people think gay marriage is wrong. But there is no good reason why it should not be legal. Some say gay couples are bad for families. But gay relationships are different. They are like two sides of the same coin. They are different, but still similar.

Gay marriage is a civil right. It means having the same rights as straight couples. For example, if a gay partner is sick, they can visit their partner in the hospital. They can make medical decisions for each other.

Many studies show that gay couples are just as happy as straight couples. They have the same kind of love and commitment.

Gay people are not asking to marry in church. They just want a marriage certificate from the government. This is a legal matter, not a religious one.

Some people say that gay marriage is against their religion. But the government should not make laws based on religion.

Gay marriage is like segregation. It is unfair to treat gay couples differently.

People worry about adoption and children. Will children of gay parents be okay?

Studies show that children of gay parents are just as happy and well-adjusted as children of straight parents.

Some schools treat children of gay parents badly. This is wrong. All children deserve to be treated fairly.

The government should make gay marriage legal in all states. This is the fair and right thing to do.

I work at a hospital pharmacy in the summer.  I think drugs should be legal if they are good for people. Some drugs are illegal, but good for health.  
For example, some people use oxycodone, Vicodin, and Percocet. These are strong drugs, but doctors use them to help people.  
I think marijuana is like these drugs. It can help people. We should not say it is bad just because it is illegal. 

Alcohol is also bad if you use too much. But, marijuana is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. People think marijuana is bad because it is illegal. If we change people's minds, they might use it safely.

The church has changed to fit the twenty-first century. It is not as strict as before. When I was young, I went to church every Sunday. I wore a cute dress, matching shoes, and a matching purse. I went to a private school, and I saw my friends there on the weekends. We would go to church together.

Now, there is a special mass for teenagers that is only thirty minutes long. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They come in their beach clothes. Families often run in late. Even at the morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

The biggest change I see is how casual people dress.

I don't know much about the church's politics, but this is what I see.



About the accusations against priests, I don't think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped this. Some married men become pedophiles. It is a person's choice to become a priest.

Some religions allow priests to marry. If people want to practice their faith and be married, they could choose a different religion.

I think pedophilia is genetic. People are born that way. It is not about how they are raised. A marriage cannot hide it. 

If the church knew about abuse and covered it up, that is wrong. But I don't think they always knew.

I am not happy about the Iraq War.  After 9/11, the Bush government said Iraq was involved. They said Saddam Hussein had weapons. This is not true. 

The Bush government lied to America. Colin Powell spoke at the UN. He said he did not believe the evidence, even when he spoke. This is wrong. It is wrong to lie to the people. I think the Bush government does not respect our rules.

I think they wanted to go to war from the start.  I think they wanted to hurt Saddam Hussein because his father hurt America before.  I think they wanted to control Iraq's oil. 

The war has gone on too long. Leaving now will cause problems. Iraq might have a civil war.  

The UN and America want other countries to help. They want Syria and Saudi Arabia to help. But this will cause more problems.

Iraq should be in control of itself. The government is not working well. The Parliament is not strong. The Prime Minister does not have power.

There are many groups fighting for control.  The leader of one group, Muqtada al-Sadr, has many seats in Parliament. 

It is hard to say what will happen.

I feel the war in Iraq is a complicated problem.  It began after the attacks on September 11th. Many people think the war was a way for the United States to get revenge on Iraq.

I do not like the war. I do not understand all the details. It seems like we are trying to help Iraq build a democracy, but it is taking a long time. Some people also think we want to control Iraq's oil.

Staying in Iraq has made people angry. If we leave now, they may be upset that we did not help them build a strong democracy.

Building a democracy is difficult. It takes time and effort. It is unfair to force a new system on a country.

I know many families have loved ones in Iraq. I want them to come home safely.  

But I worry about what staying in Iraq means for the people there. The war has caused a lot of damage. It has made it hard for people to live normal lives. 

I also worry about the United States. Staying in Iraq is expensive and dangerous. It makes the president look weak.

The war in Iraq is a difficult situation.  I do not know the best solution.

I do not think it is right to make this action legal. I do not think any state should make it legal. I think it is up to the churches. The Constitution says the government and church should be separate. This is clear. It is written in the Constitution. I think it is wrong to try to control this. It would go against what the Constitution says.

Some people want to make it illegal. I think they are choosing one church's beliefs over others. Most Catholics and Christians do not support this. 

The separation of church and state is important. It allows for religious freedom in the United States. Even if they try to make a change to the Constitution, I think it would be wrong. It would go against what is already there. This change would be one of the few that restricts people, not the government.

I do not think the government should be involved. The president is pushing for this change because it goes against his beliefs as a Catholic. He is choosing one religion over others. I think it is up to the churches to decide, not the government. There is no good reason to change the Constitution. I don't see how it would affect the economy or anything else. It might even be good for society.

The war in Iraq is a complex issue. Many people, including myself, believe the government was not honest with the American people about the reasons for war. The invasion was linked to the September 11th attacks, but the connection was weak. The government used the tragedy to influence public opinion and start the war in 2003.

I am against war, especially preemptive strikes. The Iraq War feels like a repeat of the Vietnam War. The government should have learned from past mistakes. Many American soldiers died in Iraq. The goal was to remove the Iraqi government and install a democracy.  

However, the government was not prepared for the consequences. Removing a government creates a power vacuum and chaos. This happened in Vietnam too. The US tried to remove communists and establish democracy, but it was a long and difficult struggle.

The US government should have known this would be a difficult war.  

I think we should have planned better. We need to consider all possible outcomes before going to war. The government did not plan for what would happen after removing the Iraqi government. 

We are still in Iraq in 2006, with many American troops still dying. We are trying to train Iraqi troops and police, but it is a slow process. The US government made it seem like the war would be quick and successful, which was not realistic. 

Implementing a new government takes time and effort. It took a long time for the United States to become a successful democracy. We should not have expected Iraq to be different.

The government should have been honest with the people about the difficulties of this war.

Deciding whether to leave Iraq is difficult. We cannot abandon the people after removing their government.

However, we also need to consider the cost in American lives. How many casualties are too many?

We need to ask why we are only focusing on Iraq. Why not other countries that need help? Oil is a major factor in these decisions.

The initial justification for war, weapons of mass destruction, was not true. We knew North Korea had weapons, but we did not attack them. This raises questions about the government's motives.


I hope for peace in Iraq soon. But it seems unlikely.

I support gay marriage. I have always supported it. I think it is a personal choice. It is something that can be biological, not just a choice people make. It is not fair to take away rights from people because of something they cannot control.  

I think it is wrong to deny people rights because of who they love.  There are gay couples in my neighborhood. They live like other families. They walk their dogs and live their lives.  

I do not think politics should decide who can get married. It is a personal matter. The government should not tell people who they can love.  

I have read that being gay might be something a person is born with. It could be in their genes.  It may not be a choice. 

Why is it so different for gay people? If a man and a woman want to get married, they can. But gay people cannot, even if they want to. That is not fair. Marriage should be a private matter, not something the government controls.

The internet is public. When you post things online, everyone can see them. As a resident assistant, I have seen this happen.

If you post about violence or hurting people, someone will notice. The school must act if they hear about it. They cannot ignore it.

But it is hard to know what is serious and what is a joke. Sometimes people say things online that they do not mean.

In one case, someone heard a student talk about hurting people. They told the school. The school looked at the student's Facebook page. There were things on the page that were scary. 

When you post online, you lose your privacy. If you do not want people to see it, do not post it. 

The school should not look at students' social media without a reason. But if someone tells them about something dangerous, they have to take it seriously.

I do not think teachers should be friends with their students on Facebook or Myspace. It is not right to watch what they post.

I feel the war has lasted too long. The goal at the start was good. We wanted to help another country have democracy. But now, I think we have forgotten that goal. We may be fighting just to show we are powerful. 

I also think the reasons for starting the war were not good. President Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein before. So, I think the war may have been started for personal reasons.

If the war was to help people have a fair government, that would be good. But I think our reason for fighting has changed. It seems like we are fighting just to keep fighting.

The war should have ended after the first few months. We made our point then. It has been going on for many years, and it is too long.

Our soldiers need to come home. The country needs to spend money on its own problems, like poverty and bad schools. We have many people in need here, and we should help them.  

Spending billions of dollars on war is not good. We need to use that money to help our own people.

The war should end.

Can I ask a question to be sure?

Uh, it was stopped because someone saw it online.

Okay. 

Um, no, I do not think that is an invasion of privacy. On sites like Myspace, if you put information online, it is for everyone to see. I understand on Myspace you need a friend request to see someone's profile. You have to agree to be friends to let them see your information. So, you give them permission.

Anytime you put information online, many people can see it.  So I think it is good that someone saw it and could stop something bad from happening.

Um, it is hard. One person can't watch everyone's profile to prevent problems. But it would be unfair to target bad students.

I don't know. It depends on the situation. Did someone randomly look at profiles, or were they looking for evidence?

Sure. Um, I don't have Myspace, but I have Facebook. I worry that bad people can see things about me. I saw a story on TV about a man who got information easily. He found a girl's screen name and started talking to her on instant messenger.

I would never meet someone like that. I have had people in my classes message me on Facebook. They don't use their real names, but I know it is them. It is strange because they know my interests, what I look like, my class schedule, my friends. They see lots of photos of me.

I try to be careful about what I post, but I also want to connect with friends. It is a hard balance. I only accept friend requests from people I know, but you never know who can see what.

Um, my roommate told me that her high school banned Myspace. That seems strange. I don't know if that is a privacy issue, but I don't think the school has the right to tell students what they can and cannot do online.

I feel bad talking about this. It is hard to say I was against the war from the start. Many people were against it, but it is not important now. The government does not want to admit they made a mistake. 

Most people think the war was a bad idea. Polls show that seventy-five to eighty percent of the world thinks so, including most Iraqis and U.S. troops. 

The war was a disaster from the beginning. Leaving will also be a disaster. There is no easy way to deal with the Middle East.

The United States and the Middle East are very different. The government thinks they can bring democracy to the Middle East, but it will not work. The people there want to live their own way.

Saddam Hussein was bad, but we should have thought about the consequences before we invaded Iraq. It turned into a disaster.

I do not see a reason to stay in Iraq.

I do not agree with the reasons the government gives for staying. They talk about problems that will happen if we leave, but I do not think those problems are real.

If we want to leave, we should do it quickly.

Eighty percent of Iraqis want us to leave within a year. A quarter want us to leave now. They are the people we are trying to help.

Maybe they know best. If we ask them if we should leave and they say yes, then it is not our fault if things go wrong.

We will never be the good guys in the Middle East, but leaving would be better than staying.

I agree that gender discrimination is still a problem in the United States. It is not just a problem for women. It also affects men in certain fields.

For example, women often face a "glass ceiling" in the workplace. Even though equality is important, many women find it hard to reach top positions. They may be qualified, but some people might not want to promote them because society has always seen men in leadership roles.

Men also face discrimination. In some fields like fashion, men might be taken less seriously. People might assume that men who are interested in fashion don't truly understand it.

Another example is stay-at-home dads. It is uncommon for men to stay home and care for children. Some people think men should work and be the main earner. This can be hard on men who want to stay home and raise their children.

Changing these views takes time. Society has made progress, but change is slow.

We need to keep working to make things fairer. It's good to see more women in leadership roles and more men staying home with their children.

The best way to change things is to show people that these different roles are valuable. By highlighting the positive qualities of these individuals, we can help change people's minds.

They did not make marijuana legal. They changed the law so it is not a crime. It is now more like a traffic ticket. You get a ticket, not arrested.  Many people worry about the effect on jobs and other things.  

It cost a lot of money to arrest people, hold them, and put them in court. This money could be used for schools, help for the elderly, or food for the homeless. Some communities do not want to use this money to pay for these things.  

In Denver, people are more open to this change. They think it is good for the city's money.

Marijuana should not be everywhere, like cigarettes. People would smoke it in cars, which is dangerous. Many people still think it is wrong to smoke marijuana.  

Alcohol has stronger effects on driving, but marijuana can have a bigger impact on people's lives.  

Everyone reacts to drugs differently. Some people can use them in a healthy way, while others have problems.

I think yes. 
Because many things they do are very old. 
They have done them for a long time.
It is good to follow traditions. 
But it is also good to change. 
Many Catholics go to church every week. 
They are strict about how things are done. 
Sometimes I think the Catholic Church judges people who do not follow all the rules. 
They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. 
They also do not accept people of other religions. 
For example, my father was an Episcopalian. 
My mother was a Catholic. 
They could not marry in the Catholic Church because of my father's religion. 
This is not being kind to other religions. 
We were taught to love others. 
This is a Catholic teaching. 
But it is wrong to say love others and not accept them. 
So I think many Catholic rules tell people to do things. 
But Catholic practice goes against these rules. 
The rules are old. 
But they keep using them.

I do not think this would change things. 
I think it would be good if priests could marry. 
But this would not stop them from hurting children. 
This is a different problem. 

People who hurt children would probably do it even if they were married. 
It is about the child, not the spouse. 
If someone wants to hurt a child, they will do it. 
Allowing priests to marry would not stop this.

I am not sure about this issue. I do not think either side is right or wrong. This is a very hard topic. It is hard to talk about religion and government at the same time. It is also hard to say what marriage is. I think all couples should have civil unions. I do not think the government should say what kind of marriage is right. If two people love each other, they should be able to get married. The government should not care if they are a man and a woman or two men or two women. People should not get special tax breaks or treatment just because they are married. The government should not tell people what to believe.

If all the states agree on a law, then they can make it a federal law. But it is wrong to change the Constitution to ban gay marriage. The Constitution is for important things, not for things like this.

I am raised in a Christian home.  Homosexuality is hard for me. I have gay friends. I do not agree with this way of life, but I think it should be legal. It should not be a national problem. Each state should decide.

Many states are Democratic. Many states are Republican. Democratic states support gay marriage. If you live in a Democratic state, you know how that state feels. I think you should accept that if a state legalizes gay marriage. You chose to live there.

I think gay people should have the same chances as straight people.  I think gay marriage should be legal by each state's choice.

I already said this, but I do not think President Bush should say the whole country is against gay marriage. It should be up to each state. I do not like his ban on gay marriage.

I do not think President Bush should decide for every state. He does not live in every state. He should not tell states how to run themselves.

Maybe a new president will change the ban on gay marriage.  It will just go back and forth. It should be up to each state. They will have to live with the decision. Not the president.

I do not agree. Myspace is a public site. It is like a bulletin board. If you post something, everyone can see it. This includes school officials.

Even if they are not looking at it under the school's name, they can still see it from home. So, if the school sees something on Myspace that could prevent a school shooting, they have the right to see it.

Their job is to keep students safe. I think it is okay if they look at Myspace to make the school safer.

But, I think it is wrong if they look at Myspace just to find students doing bad things. They should not be looking for trouble.

If they see something that could help prevent a problem, like a school shooting, then it is okay. Remember, everything on the internet stays there forever.

It is like an email. If you write something bad about someone in an email, it could come back to haunt you later.

Even if you are a grown-up, things you post online can be found. It is always better to be careful about what you post.

The war was a bad idea. At first, I supported it. I felt hurt from nine eleven. I wanted revenge.  I thought we should make them suffer like we did. But now I think we made a big mistake. We went in without a plan. We did not think about the long term. We did not understand their culture.

Fighting there made things worse. They fight with each other, so we should let them. We cannot fix their problems. I do not care about what happens to them anymore. It feels like they are not human because they fight so much. 

We went to war unprepared. We did not know what to expect. War is different for them. They are savage. They do not want to make their country better. They want us to leave. I think we should leave.

We were angry after nine eleven. President Bush wanted to go to war. The people wanted him to. He felt we had to fight. I understand why he felt that way. We could not just ignore what happened. But we should have planned better.

We did not know what to do. There was no unity. We did not have a clear goal. We were driven by anger, not reason. This only made things worse.

I don’t think we can change them. They will always be like this. We have not made enough progress to justify staying there. We are hurting ourselves by staying. We should leave.
